com.codename1.rad.nodes

Class Node<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codename1.rad.models.Attribute<T>
      • com.codename1.rad.nodes.Node<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionNode, ActionsNode, ActionViewFactoryNode, ComponentDecoratorNode, EntityViewFactoryNode, EventFactoryNode, FieldNode, FormNode, ListNode, OptionsNode, PropertyNode, PropertyViewDecoratorNode, PropertyViewFactoryNode, RowTemplateNode, SectionNode, SwipeContainer, TableColumns, ViewNode

    public abstract class Node<T>
extends Attribute<T>

    A special type of attribute that can contain child nodes. This is the basis of the UI descriptor hierarchy.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      Node attributes.
      protected NodeList childNodes 
      protected Map<ViewProperty,ViewPropertyParameter> viewParameters
      View parameters which can be used for setting properties in views.

    • Method Detail

      • proxy

        public Node<T> proxy(Node parent)

        Create a proxy for this node. The node class must implement Proxyable

        Parameters:
        parent - The parent node of the proxy node.
        Returns:
        The proxy node.

      • canProxy

        public boolean canProxy()

        Returns true if this node can be proxied. Default return value is false. Subclasses that allow proxying should implement the Proxyable interface, and return true for this method.

        Returns:

      • setProxying

        public void setProxying(Node<T> originalNode)

        Converts this node into a proxy node.

        Parameters:
        originalNode -

      • getProxying

        public Node<T> getProxying()

        Gets the node that this node proxies.

        Returns:

      • getCanonicalNode

        public Node getCanonicalNode()

        Returns the original node in a proxy chain. If this node is not proxying any nodes, then it will return itself.

        Returns:

      • proxyingIterator

        public Iterator<Node<T>> proxyingIterator()

        Gets an iterator for iterating up the proxy chain. If this is not a proxy node then this will return an empty iterator.

        Returns:

      • setParent

        public void setParent(Node parent)

        Sets the parent node. You cannot re-assign a non-null parent on a node that already has a non-null parent. A workaround is to first set parent to null, then set the parent again to the new parent. Some node types, such as Actions, need to appear in multiple places in the UI tree. In such cases, a proxy node is created for the action in the various positions of the tree.

        Parameters:
        parent -

      • findAttribute

        public <V extends Attribute> V findAttribute(Class<V> type)

        Returns an attribute of the given type for this node. If this is a proxy node, it will first check its own attributes. If none is found, it will check the node that it is proxying for the attribute.

        Type Parameters:
        V - The type of attribute to return.
        Parameters:
        type - The attribute type.
        Returns:
        The attribute, or null, if this node doesn’t have an attribute of this type.

      • findInheritedAttribute

        public <V extends Attribute> V findInheritedAttribute(Class<V> type)

        Find an attribute in this node, or a parent node. This first checks the current node for the given attribute. If none is found, it will check the parent node. It will walk up the UI tree to the root until it finds an attribute of this type. If none is found, it will check the proxy node, and walk up the tree from there.

        Type Parameters:
        V - The attribute type to retrieve.
        Parameters:
        type - The attribute type.
        Returns:
        An attribute of the given type, or null if none found.

      • getViewParameter

        public <V> ViewPropertyParameter<V> getViewParameter(ViewProperty<V> prop)

        Gets a view parameter for this node. This will walk up the tree until it finds a parameter for the given view property. View properties are defined generally inside the View that consumes them. You can then set values or bindings on these properties in the UI tree using the UI#param() method.

        Type Parameters:
        V - The view parameter type
        Parameters:
        prop - The property to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The property parameter, or null if none found.

      • getViewParameterValue

        public <V> V getViewParameterValue(ViewProperty<V> prop)

        Gets the value of a view parameter.

        Type Parameters:
        V -
        Parameters:
        prop -
        Returns:

      • getViewParameterValue

        public <V> V getViewParameterValue(ViewProperty<V> prop,
                                   V defaultValue)

        Gets the value of a view parameter

        Type Parameters:
        V - The ViewProperty type.
        Parameters:
        prop - The view property
        defaultValue - The default value returned in the case where no such view property is found on this node.
        Returns:
        The view parameter value.

      • getViewParameter

        public <V> ViewPropertyParameter<V> getViewParameter(ViewProperty<V> prop,
                                                     ViewPropertyParameter<V> defaultVal)

        Gets a view parameter for this node. This will walk up the tree until it finds a parameter for the given view property. View properties are defined generally inside the View that consumes them. You can then set values or bindings on these properties in the UI tree using the UI#param() method.

        Type Parameters:
        V - The view parameter type.
        Parameters:
        prop - The property to retrieve.
        defaultVal - Default value in case no property found.
        Returns:

      • getActions

        public Actions getActions(ActionNode.Category category)

        Gets actions on this node in the given category. This will not include actions defined in parent nodes. See getInheritedActions(com.codename1.rad.nodes.ActionNode.Category) if you want to also include actions defined in parents.

        Parameters:
        category -
        Returns:

      • getAction

        public ActionNode getAction(ActionNode.Category category)

        Gets an action defined on this node that matches the given category. This will not check parent nodes for matching actions. See getInheritedAction(com.codename1.rad.nodes.ActionNode.Category) if you want to also check parent nodes for matching actions.

        Parameters:
        category -
        Returns:

      • getInheritedActions

        public Actions getInheritedActions(ActionNode.Category category)

        Gets actions on this node, and parent node(s) in the given category.

        Parameters:
        category -
        Returns:

      • getInheritedAction

        public ActionNode getInheritedAction(ActionNode.Category category)

        Gets action matching the given category in this node. If none is found in the current node, it will check the parent node for matches.

        Parameters:
        category -
        Returns:

      • getUIIDPrefix

        public UIIDPrefix getUIIDPrefix()

        Gets UIIDPrefix attribute of this node. This will crawl up the parent hierarchy until it finds a UIIDPrefix setting.

        Returns:

      • getIconUIID

        public IconUIID getIconUIID()

        Gets IconUIID attribute of this node. This will NOT check the parent node.

        Returns:

      • getDateFormatter

        public DateFormatterAttribute getDateFormatter()

        Gets DataFormatterAttribute of this node. This will crawl up the parent hierarchy until it finds a date formatter.

        Returns:

      • createPropertySelector

        public PropertySelector createPropertySelector(Entity entity)

        Creates a property selector on the given entity using (in order of decreasing precedence):

        1. A PropertyNode attribute on the node.

        2. A Tags attribute on the node.

        3. A PropertySelectorAttribute on the node.

        Parameters:
        entity - The entity on which the property selector should be created.
        Returns:
        The property selector.
